references.paper_title: Gaussian processes for data fulfilling linear differential equations
references.reason: This paper introduces the foundational concept of using Gaussian processes to model data that satisfies linear differential equations, a key idea underlying the current work.

references.paper_title: Natural gradient works efficiently in learning
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of natural gradient, which is critical for the efficient optimization used in this work.

references.paper_title: Probabilistic Numerics: Computation as Machine Learning
references.reason: This book provides a comprehensive overview of probabilistic numerics, which is the theoretical basis for the physics-informed methods used in this paper.

This paper introduces the idea of using sparse Gaussian process methods to improve computational efficiency when dealing with large datasets, which is highly relevant to the work presented in this paper.

references.paper_title: The statistical finite element method (statFEM) for coherent synthesis of observation data and model predictions
references.reason: This paper introduces the statFEM, a novel framework that combines machine learning and finite element methods for solving partial differential equations, closely related to the proposed PHYSS-GP.
